pull.title: gui: remove macOS start on login code
pull.body:
The macOS startup item code was disabled for builds targeting macOS >
`10.11` in #15208. Now that we require macOS `10.12` as a minimum (#17550),
we can remove the startup item code entirely. The API we were using, `LSSharedFileListItemCopyResolvedURL`, `LSSharedFileListCopySnapshot` etc,
was removed in macOS `10.12` SDK.

gui: remove macOS start on login code

The macOS startup item code was disabled for builds targeting macOS >
10.11 in #15208. Now that we require macOS 10.12 as a minimum, #17550,
we can remove the startup item code entirely, as the API we were using
was removed in macOS 10.12.

events.message:
gui: remove macOS start on login code

The macOS startup item code was disabled for builds targeting macOS >
10.11 in #15208. Now that we require macOS 10.12 as a minimum, #17550,
we can remove the startup item code entirely, as the API we were using
was removed in macOS 10.12.

events.body:
ACK.

If someone means to add this functionality again in the future, I think something like #9005 would be required.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ Low-level Changes section below.
 GUI changes
 -----------
 
+- The "Start Bitcoin Core on system login" option has been removed on macOS.
comments.body: Please mention that it was already not working on recent MacOS versions (so effectively this is an user-invisible change).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ Low-level Changes section below.
 GUI changes
 -----------
 
+- The "Start Bitcoin Core on system login" option has been removed on macOS.
comments.body: This change will actually be user facing, as the current release binaries include this option in the preferences menu (0.19 was compiled with a macOS 10.10 minimum and targeting the 10.11 SDK).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ Low-level Changes section below.
 GUI changes
 -----------
 
+- The "Start Bitcoin Core on system login" option has been removed on macOS.
comments.body: So the option was there, but it wasn't working on newer MacOS?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ Low-level Changes section below.
 GUI changes
 -----------
 
+- The "Start Bitcoin Core on system login" option has been removed on macOS.
comments.body: The option was there, and it should have been working for all versions of macOS (I can only test up to 10.14). Note that there are plenty of ways for the user to create the "start at login" behaviour without us providing an option from within Bitcoin Core.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ Low-level Changes section below.
 GUI changes
 -----------
 
+- The "Start Bitcoin Core on system login" option has been removed on macOS.
comments.body:
Ok, thanks for explaining.

The way MacOS does things is really confusing here. So we need to remove the functionality because the calls are deprecated, but they still work fine, even on newer MacOS, if compiled with an older MacOS in mind.

> Note that there are plenty of ways for the user to create the "start at login" behaviour without us providing an option from within Bitcoin Core.

I remember we used a different way based on scripts in the past. That way was deprecated, too :angry: Although annoying for users which rely on this functionality, I tend to agree it's not worth coming up with a new hack here every time.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ Low-level Changes section below.
 GUI changes
 -----------
 
+- The "Start Bitcoin Core on system login" option has been removed on macOS.
comments.body:
> they still work fine, even on newer MacOS, if compiled with an older MacOS in mind

They work just fine even when compiling for the latest macOS
